item.title: Porter’s Five Forces: How to identiy attractive markets
item.description: Whether you&rsquo;re starting your own business, building an existing venture or tackling a problem that affects a multinational company, Porter&rsquo;s Five Forces is a brilliant model for helping you analyse market attractiveness

item.title: There’s Something About Mobile
item.description: A lot has been said and done about mobile lately. But what is it exactly that makes mobile so special? And how can advertisers leverage the uniqueness of mobile devices and deliver true added value to their customers? A presentation by Glenn Van Hoof and Nikolas Sterck for Arteveldehogeschool Gent.
item.content:encoded: A lot has been said and done about mobile lately. But what is it exactly that makes mobile so special? And how can advertisers leverage the uniqueness of mobile devices and deliver true added value to their customers? A presentation by Glenn Van Hoof and Nikolas Sterck for Arteveldehogeschool Gent.

item.title: Six Habits of SOCIAL Entrepreneurs
item.description: What makes some entrepreneurs succeed while others fail? Charles Tsai of Social Creatives argues that it all boils down to six best practices - or habits. These six are fundamental to creating positive change in today&rsquo;s world. (They also correspond to the letters in the word, SOCIAL.)
item.content:encoded: What makes some entrepreneurs succeed while others fail? Charles Tsai of Social Creatives argues that it all boils down to six best practices - or habits. These six are fundamental to creating positive change in today&rsquo;s world. (They also correspond to the letters in the word, SOCIAL.)

item.title: Hugh Hefner, Sherlock Holmes & Indiana Jones: Making the Case for Mobile Intelligent Content
item.description:
There are 726 million 3G mobile phone subscribers. Yet most companies are not designing intelligent content for them. It&rsquo;s a huge opportunity. As part of a Keynote I gave at ICC 2011, I highlight three companies that are doing it well (SCVNGR, Flirt.com, and Shazam.com).
Come follow along as I highlight the reasons why you need to be developing intelligent content for mobile devices.
item.content:encoded:
There are 726 million 3G mobile phone subscribers. Yet most companies are not designing intelligent content for them. It&rsquo;s a huge opportunity. As part of a Keynote I gave at ICC 2011, I highlight three companies that are doing it well (SCVNGR, Flirt.com, and Shazam.com).
Come follow along as I highlight the reasons why you need to be developing intelligent content for mobile devices.
item.author: fidelman@slideshare.net(fidelman)

Come follow along as I highlight the reasons why you need to be developing intelligent content for mobile devices.

item.title: Don’t Be A PowerPoint Felon
item.description:
A tongue-in-cheek presentation with 3 tips to avoid being a PowerPoint criminal.
These are slides from a humorous/informative speech I wrote for a recent Toastmasters meeting. I&rsquo;ve modified the presentation since then so that it can stand on its own.
Spanish Version (thanks to David Gomez): http://www.slideshare.net/mercadeobienpensado/no-sea-un-criminal-del-powerpoint

item.title: Top 10 Facebook Contests by Airlines
item.description: Facebook has become the hottest playground in social media. Inevitably, airlines keen to build their brands online while driving greater customer engagement have taken to organizing creative contests on their Facebook pages.

item.title: Burson-Marsteller 2011 Global Social Media Check-up
